dataset.title: MCR LTER: Coral Reef: Gump Station Meteorological Data, ongoing since 2006

abstract.para: These data provide near real time meteorological information measured at the GUMP research station on the north shore of Moorea island, French Polynesia. Data collection began in August, 2006 and include air temperature, relative humidity, wind speed and direction, solar radiation, atmospheric pressure, and integrated rainfall. All sensors are sampled every 5 minutes. Post processing of these data is limited to some unit conversion and exclusion of corrupted data records. This data package is a static snapshot of the real-time data.
Aggregate data are provided in daily, weekly, monthly and yearly time bins.
ClimDB data for station GUMPM are derived from the same data source.

keywordSet.keyword: Richard B. Gump South Pacific Research Station

intellectualRights.para:
Data collected under the auspices of the MCR LTER are available to the public after primary publication, or at most two years after the completion of the study unless proprietary restrictions are warranted. Use of MCR LTER data is subject to acceptance of the following conditions:
1. The user agrees to provide valid name and contact information prior to downloading online data. This information will be used to contact the user in case of changes to the data, and may also be used by data set authors and MCR LTER project administrators to document data usage.
2. The user agrees to cite the data set author and MCR LTER in all publications in which the data are used, as per the instructions in the data documentation. If no specific instructions are provided in the data documentation, the user is requested to include the following statement: "Data sets were provided by the Moorea Coral Reef Ecosystem LTER, funded by the US National Science Foundation (OCE-0417412)."
3. The user agrees to provide one copy of any manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the data set author prior to submitting it for publication.
4. The user agrees to send two hard copies of any published manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the following address: Dr. Andrew J. Brooks Deputy Program Director, MCR LTER Marine Science Institute University of California Santa Barbara, CA 93106-6150 The user also agrees to send one electronic copy (pdf format) to the following e-mail address: brooks@msi.ucsb.edu
5. Users are prohibited from selling or redistributing any data provided by MCR LTER without explicit prior permission.
6. Users are encouraged to contact original investigators responsible for data. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on MCR LTER data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators.
7. Extensive efforts are made to ensure that online data are accurate and up to date, but the authors and the MCR LTER will not take responsibility for any errors that may exist in data provided online. Furthermore, the user assumes all responsibility for errors in analysis or judgment resulting from use of the data.
8. Any violation of the terms of this agreement will result in immediate forfeiture of the data and loss of access privileges to other MCR LTER data sets.

section.para: This is an ongoing dataset containing snapshots of a real-time data stream recorded every 5 minutes. Archive updated aproximately monthly.

The air pressure was written in mmHg until 2006-10-16 21:15:00 (inclusive). It was converted to mbar with the constant 1 mmHg = 0.7524 mbar, which is the constant at 60 degree F, suggested by Chris Gotschalk.
Solar radiance units were corrected on 2010-10-20.
The datetimes from September 2008 thru 2010 had been in Pacific Time. As of revision 22 on 2011-03-16 all datetimes are in UTC.
2008-01-03 thru 2008-02-03, inclusive, had interpolated data instead of missing-value codes. Fixed on 2011-04-20.
2010-10-20 thru 2011-06 (estimate): meteorologic station offline for repair.

changeHistory.comment: New data recieved 2012-02-27, replaces all aggregate tables
A typo was corrected. Wind Speed m/s was miss-labeled Wind Speed STD. The name and definition were correct.

The dataset update of November 2012 replaces earlier versions for all but the raw real-time cache. This new version was made from the Campbell Datalogger directly, unlike earlier versions which passed through the DataTurbine real-time system. The raw CR1000 output file is stored internally as gots/mcr_met_tabledat/met/Gump_20080915_CR1000_Table1.dat
Suspected bad values for rainfall in December 2012 and January 2013. Flagged as unavailable.pwd

section.title: Location description:
section.para: The meteorologic station is at Richard B. Gump South Pacific Research Station. The instruments are 6 m above mean sea level. Weather station is atop a small building. No surrounding buildings significantly obscure the sky. Some palm trees are within 100m. The building is within 100m of the shore. This is station GUMPM in ClimDB.

section.title: Instrument Maintenance:
section.para: Every site visit the station is checked. Some sensors are on an annual calibration schedule. Real-time streaming data to a web page enables regular quick-checks of sensor health.

protocol.title: Meteorology Time Series Protocol - Gump Met Station

section.title: Digital Moorea: a Near-real-time Sensor Network
section.para: The weather station data is streamed near-real-time through Data Turbine as part of the Digital Moorea project.

protocol.title: Meteorology Time Series Protocol - Digital Moorea

creator.organizationName: Cyberinfrastructure Laboratory for Environmental Observing Systems (CLEOS)

section.title: Instrument Manuals:
section.para: This is a collection of manuals for the instruments on the met station.

protocol.title: Instrument Manual - Barometric Pressure Sensor CS100
Instrument Manual - LI200X Pyranometer
protocol.additionalInfo: Solar Radiation is recorded in kW/m2, equivalent to kJ/s/m2, as average instantaneous values.

protocol.title: Instrument Manual - CSI Model TB4 Rain Gage
Instrument Manual - HMP45C Temperature and Relative Humidity Probe
Instrument Manual - R.M. Young Wind Monitor

section.title: Quality Assurance for aggregate completeness
section.para: Data coverage fraction is between 0 and 1 and is defined as the number of measurements actually available divided by the number of measurements theoretically possible in the time aggregation bin (time period).

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Biological Sciences, California State University
Department of Biological Sciences, California State University

dataTable.entityDescription: The meteorologic data every 5 minutes, processed.

qualityControl.description: Data coverage fraction is defined as the number of measurements actually available divided by the number of measurements theoretically possible in the time aggregation bin (time period). N_measurements_available / ( time_span / measurement_period )

dataTable.additionalInfo: A known issue exists with timestamps between 2008-09-17 and 2009-03-30.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Moorea local time string (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss) at start of bin (time period). Always ten hours earlier than UTC.
UTC time string (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss) at start of bin (time period)
Air temperature averaged 5min from a originally 10 second sampling interval.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this time, or not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: 1.00 = data present; 0.00 = data absent for air_temp_C
Wind stress is the shear stress exerted by the wind on the water surface. It is the force component parallel to the surface, per unit area, as applied by the wind on the water surface.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this time, or not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: 1.00 = data present; 0.00 = data absent for wind_stress_pa
Wind direction clockwise from true North, averaged 5min from a originally 10 second sampling interval.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this time, or not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: 1.00 = data present; 0.00 = data absent for wind_direction_degtrue
East component of Vector Wind Speed in a 5 minute interval, originally sampled at a 10 second interval. Wind blowing from the northwest will have a positive U value and negative V value.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this time, or not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: 1.00 = data present; 0.00 = data absent for wind_U_mps
North component of Vector Wind Speed in a 5 minute interval, originally sampled at a 10 second interval. Wind blowing from the northwest will have a positive U value and negative V value.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this time, or not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: 1.00 = data present; 0.00 = data absent for wind_V_mps
Solar radiation averaged 5min from a originally 10 second sampling interval.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this time, or not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: 1.00 = data present; 0.00 = data absent for mean_solar_rad_kwpm2
Atmospheric pressure averaged 5min from a originally 10 second sampling interval.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this time, or not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: 1.00 = data present; 0.00 = data absent for atm_press_mbar
Precipitation 5min total (the mass flux density of rain integrated over 5 minute intervals, summed daily).

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: No measurement collected at this time, or not available.

attribute.attributeDefinition: 1.00 = data present; 0.00 = data absent for cumulative_rainfall_mm

dataTable.entityDescription: The raw meteorologic data are recorded every 5 minutes and lack QA/QC.
dataTable.additionalInfo: A known issue exists with timestamps between 2008-09-17 and 2009-03-30. This dataset is raw data, as received.
